required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Objective Assessment of Activity and Sleep Quality In Burst Spinal Cord Stimulation
clinical_study.official_title: Objective Assessment of Activity and Sleep Quality In Burst Spinal Cord Stimulation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess feasibility of using wearable sensors to capture objective assessments of patient's activity and sleep quality during the spinal cord stimulation (SCS) treatment continuum.

detailed_description.textblock: Eligible patients will undergo standard clinical care using BurstDR SCS and will be asked to wear a wrist worn accelerometer for a baseline period, during SCS trial and for 3 months after activation of the SCS stimulation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and the end of spinal cord stimulation trial period (average of 1 month)
primary_outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Medium to Vigorous Physical Activity (MVPA) were calculated based on accelerometry data. MVPA value represents the hours of medium to vigorous physical activity in a day.

primary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and the end of spinal cord stimulation trial period (average of 1 month)
primary_outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Sleep duration was calculated based on accelerometry data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and the end of spinal cord stimulation trial period (average of 1 month)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective evaluation of pain levels used in clinical practice as standard. Minimum value is 0 (no pain), maximum value is 10 (maximum pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 1 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective evaluation of pain levels used in clinical practice as standard. Minimum value is 0 (no pain), maximum value is 10 (maximum pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 2 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective evaluation of pain levels used in clinical practice as standard. Minimum value is 0 (no pain), maximum value is 10 (maximum pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 3 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective evaluation of pain levels used in clinical practice as standard. Minimum value is 0 (no pain), maximum value is 10 (maximum pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in European Quality of Life 5 Dimensions (EQ-5D)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and the end of spinal cord stimulation trial period (average of 1 month)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire pertaining to quality of life. Minimum Value 0, maximum value 1 with higher numbers representing higher quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in European Quality of Life 5 Dimensions (EQ-5D)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 1 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire pertaining to quality of life. Minimum Value 0, maximum value 1 with higher numbers representing higher quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in European Quality of Life 5 Dimensions (EQ-5D)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 2 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire pertaining to quality of life. Minimum Value 0, maximum value 1 with higher numbers representing higher quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in European Quality of Life 5 Dimensions (EQ-5D)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 3 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire pertaining to quality of life. Minimum Value 0, maximum value 1 with higher numbers representing higher quality of life

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and the end of spinal cord stimulation trial period (average of 1 month)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire pertaining to disability levels. Minimum value 0, maximum value 100 with higher values representing higher levels of disability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 1 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire pertaining to disability levels. Minimum value 0, maximum value 100 with higher values representing higher levels of disability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 2 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire pertaining to disability levels. Minimum value 0, maximum value 100 with higher values representing higher levels of disability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 3 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire pertaining to disability levels. Minimum value 0, maximum value 100 with higher values representing higher levels of disability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 1 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Medium to Vigorous Physical Activity (MVPA) were calculated based on accelerometry data. MVPA value represents the hours of medium to vigorous physical activity in a day. Average percent change in MVPA from baseline value is reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 1 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Sleep duration was calculated based on accelerometry data.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 2 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Medium to Vigorous Physical Activity (MVPA) were calculated based on accelerometry data. MVPA value represents the hours of medium to vigorous physical activity in a day. Average percent change in MVPA from baseline value is reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 2 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Sleep duration was calculated based on accelerometry data.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 3 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Medium to Vigorous Physical Activity (MVPA) were calculated based on accelerometry data. MVPA value represents the hours of medium to vigorous physical activity in a day. Average percent change in MVPA from baseline value is reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 3 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
secondary_outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Sleep duration was calculated based on accelerometry data.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive a wrist worn accelerometer and accelerometry will be used to monitor physical activity and sleep quality during standard BurstDR Spinal Cord Stimulation clinical treatment

intervention.description: Record of activity levels using a wrist worn accelerometer

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Activity and Sleep Quality Recording
group.description: Patients will receive a wrist worn accelerometer and accelerometry will be used to monitor physical activity and sleep quality during standard BurstDR Spinal Cord Stimulation clinical treatment Accelerometry: Record of activity levels using a wrist worn accelerometer

group.title: Activity and Sleep Quality Recording
group.description: Patients will receive a wrist worn accelerometer and accelerometry will be used to monitor physical activity and sleep quality during standard BurstDR Spinal Cord Stimulation clinical treatment Accelerometry: Record of activity levels using a wrist worn accelerometer

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change in Activity Levels
outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Medium to Vigorous Physical Activity (MVPA) were calculated based on accelerometry data. MVPA value represents the hours of medium to vigorous physical activity in a day.
outcome.time_frame: between baseline and the end of spinal cord stimulation trial period (average of 1 month)
outcome.population: Average change in MVPA (h/day) from baseline value is reported. Activity recording files were not available for 2 patients.

group.title: Activity and Sleep Quality Recording
group.description: Patients will receive a wrist worn accelerometer and accelerometry will be used to monitor physical activity and sleep quality during standard BurstDR Spinal Cord Stimulation clinical treatment Accelerometry: Record of activity levels using a wrist worn accelerometer

measure.title: Change in Activity Levels
measure.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Medium to Vigorous Physical Activity (MVPA) were calculated based on accelerometry data. MVPA value represents the hours of medium to vigorous physical activity in a day.
measure.population: Average change in MVPA (h/day) from baseline value is reported. Activity recording files were not available for 2 patients.
measure.units: change in MVPA h/day from baseline value

outcome.title: Change in Sleep Quality
outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Sleep duration was calculated based on accelerometry data.
outcome.time_frame: between baseline and the end of spinal cord stimulation trial period (average of 1 month)
outcome.population: Change in average sleep duration from baseline value is reported. Activity recording files were not available for 2 patients.

group.title: Activity and Sleep Quality Recording
group.description: Patients will receive a wrist worn accelerometer and accelerometry will be used to monitor physical activity and sleep quality during standard BurstDR Spinal Cord Stimulation clinical treatment Accelerometry: Record of activity levels using a wrist worn accelerometer

measure.title: Change in Sleep Quality
measure.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Sleep duration was calculated based on accelerometry data.
measure.population: Change in average sleep duration from baseline value is reported. Activity recording files were not available for 2 patients.

outcome.title: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Pain
outcome.description: Subjective evaluation of pain levels used in clinical practice as standard. Minimum value is 0 (no pain), maximum value is 10 (maximum pain imaginable)
outcome.time_frame: between baseline and the end of spinal cord stimulation trial period (average of 1 month)
outcome.population: Percentage change in average VAS value from baseline is reported (pain relief) Data was not available for 1 subject

outcome.title: Change in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI)
outcome.description: Questionnaire pertaining to disability levels. Minimum value 0, maximum value 100 with higher values representing higher levels of disability.
outcome.time_frame: between baseline and the end of spinal cord stimulation trial period (average of 1 month)
outcome.population: Percentage change in average ODI value from baseline is reported. One patient did not complete the ODI form correctly.

outcome.title: Change in Activity Levels
outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Medium to Vigorous Physical Activity (MVPA) were calculated based on accelerometry data. MVPA value represents the hours of medium to vigorous physical activity in a day. Average percent change in MVPA from baseline value is reported.
outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 1 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
outcome.population: Average change in MVPA (h/day) from baseline value is reported. Activity recording files were not available for 1 patient

group.title: Activity and Sleep Quality Recording
group.description: Patients will receive a wrist worn accelerometer and accelerometry will be used to monitor physical activity and sleep quality during standard BurstDR Spinal Cord Stimulation clinical treatment Accelerometry: Record of activity levels using a wrist worn accelerometer

measure.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Medium to Vigorous Physical Activity (MVPA) were calculated based on accelerometry data. MVPA value represents the hours of medium to vigorous physical activity in a day. Average percent change in MVPA from baseline value is reported.
measure.population: Average change in MVPA (h/day) from baseline value is reported. Activity recording files were not available for 1 patient
measure.units: change in MVPA h/day from baseline value

outcome.title: Change in Sleep Quality
outcome.description: Recording performed with wrist worn accelerometer. Sleep duration was calculated based on accelerometry data.
outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 1 month post permanent spinal cord stimulator activation followup
outcome.population: Change in average sleep duration from baseline value is reported. Activity recording files were not available for 1 patient

reported_events.time_frame: From baseline to 3rd month follow up for an average duration of 4.6 months (including trial and wait time between trial and permanent implant)

group.title: Activity and Sleep Quality Recording
group.description: Patients will receive a wrist worn accelerometer and accelerometry will be used to monitor physical activity and sleep quality during standard BurstDR Spinal Cord Stimulation clinical treatment Accelerometry: Record of activity levels using a wrist worn accelerometer

event.sub_title: Increased pain/inadequate pain relief that required device reprogramming

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
